column1: I  am  in  agreement  with  the  submission  of  the  learned  State  Counsel  that
although the fact of pleading guilty to a charge can be considered in mitigation
of  the  sentence,  that  alone  would  not  be  a  criterion  for  imposing  a  lenient
sentence  on  an  accused.  I  am  of  the  view  that  offering  to  pay  compensation
cannot  add  much  value  in  mitigation,  as  in  any  way,  compensation  can  be
ordered after an accused is found guilty to an offence of this nature.
